ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 4 hours
4-6 hrs
6-7 hours
6-10 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I really liked the course overall. It is a good introduction to nutrition issues. But I do think the class can be made more rigorous.

The course was designed with students in mind - and therefore was excellent in creating an environment where students could learn both technical and systematic aspects of food and nutrition. Well organized and taught course.

excellent course structure - the weekly quizzes are a lot of work but great for keeping up on the readings, and the discussion is great for stimulating conversation/thoughts.the projects are all interesting and were things i wanted to work on. The final project should be due earlier (i.e. not in exam week) so that the group has ample time to come together and be organized - there were struggles with everyone having different schedules
Course was very informative.
Great course.S: The course is organized really well.W:

This is a great course that is comprehensive in understanding nutrition and food. I also like that unlike other public health courses it doesn't focus on just the epidemiology and statistics of nutrition.More round table discussions would improve discussion in class.Would like more on some of the methodology of food and nutrition assessments out there.

Good survey of different aspects of food problems around the world. Primarily focused on undernutrition, and gave good information about different approaches that have been tried to address it and what has and hasn't worked in different contexts. The course encouraged critical evaluation of these approaches and an understanding of the reasons for success and failure.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Debbie is really wonderful and gives enthusiastic lectures.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  The instructor of the course was great, providing feedback and open to students interests and inquiries.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Excellent instructor for this course. She's great at stimulating critical thinking and asking questions

Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Strengths: ability to make class interesting, genuine interest in loabl issues, thorough knowledge-base, good personalityWeakness: it is very difficult to get a timely response to emails from her.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Great!

Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Debbie has such an interesting perspective to food and nutrition that goes beyond the current public health approach. There is always talk about more integrative approaches and she attempts to integrate that into our class and discussions that are essential to altering the current perspective on food and nutrition.

Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Professor Humphries is very good at engaging students in class discussions. She introduces students not only to the epidemeology basis of nutrition, but also cutting-edge researches in nutrition and current issues in global food security. I learned a lot in her class.

Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Debbie has a strong base of knowledge and put a lot of effort into preparing class sessions. She searched for the most recent research about the topics covered and presented a comprehensive picture of the topic.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: The TA was also helpful, ensuring prompt postings on classesv2 and clarifying any informational points needed.
Amelia was fantastic.
Amelia-great. She mainly graded assignments but her lecture on emergency nutrition was informative
Amelia is very helpful in assisting the logistics of the class. She also contributed her inisight and knowledge to the class.
Amelia - Clearly very well informed about nutrition issues.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is an excellent course for anyone looking to familiarize themselves with basic issues surround global food and nutrition.
It's a great course, take it if you want to explore and critically think about topics in nutrition and good research
Great course if you are interested at all in global health. A must take!

This course is a broad yet comprehensive course on the current work of food and nutrition as a method of intervention for public health issues. This class is highly recommended to expand your perspective on nutrition around the world.
It was awesome.
